t: Proverbs 3
Guidance for the Young
My*pn son, do not forget my law, But*ld let your heart keep my commands;
For*ld length of days and long life And*ld peace they will add to you.
Let*ln not mercy and truth forsake you; Bind*ld them around your neck, Write*ld them on the tablet of your heart,
And*ild so find favor and high esteem In*ld the sight of God and man.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s with all your heart, And*ld lean not on your own understanding;
In*ld all your ways acknowledge Him, And*ld He shall direct your paths.
Do*ln not be wise in your own eyes; Fear*ld the Lord*s and depart from evil.
It*ld will be health to your flesh, And*ld strength to your bones.
Honor*ln the Lord*s with your possessions, And*ld with the firstfruits of all your increase;
So*ld your barns will be filled with plenty, And*ld your vats will overflow with new wine.
My*ln son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord,*s Nor*ld detest His correction;
For*ld whom the Lord*s loves He corrects, Just*ld as a father the son in*i whom*i he delights.
Happy*ln is*i the man who*i finds wisdom, And*ld the man who*i gains understanding;
For*ld her proceeds are*i better than the profits of silver, And*ld her gain than fine gold.
She*ld is*i more precious than rubies, And*ld all the things you may desire cannot compare with her.
Length*ld of days is*i in her right hand, In*ld her left hand riches and honor.
Her*ld ways are*i ways of pleasantness, And*ld all her paths are*i peace.
She*ld is*i a tree of life to those who take hold of her, And*ld happy are*i all*i who retain her.
The*ln Lord*s by wisdom founded the earth; By*ld understanding He established the heavens;
By*ld His knowledge the depths were broken up, And*ld clouds drop down the dew.
My*ln son, let them not depart from your eyes— Keep*ld sound wisdom and discretion;
So*ld they will be life to your soul And*ld grace to your neck.
Then*ld you will walk safely in your way, And*ld your foot will not stumble.
When*ld you lie down, you will not be afraid; Yes,*ld you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
Do*ld not be afraid of sudden terror, Nor*ld of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
For*ld the Lord*s will be your confidence, And*ld will keep your foot from being caught.
Do*ld not withhold good from those to whom it is due, When*ld it is in the power of your hand to do so.*i
Do*ld not say to your neighbor, “Go,*ld and come back, And*ld tomorrow I will give it,”*i When*ld you have it with you.
Do*ld not devise evil against your neighbor, For*ld he dwells by you for safety’s sake.
Do*ld not strive with a man without cause, If*ld he has done you no harm.
Do*ln not envy the oppressor, And*ld choose none of his ways;
For*ld the perverse person*i is*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld His secret counsel is*i with the upright.
The*ld curse of the Lord*s is*i on the house of the wicked, But*ld He blesses the home of the just.
Surely*ld He scorns the scornful, But*ld gives grace to the humble.
The*ld wise shall inherit glory, But*ld shame shall be the legacy of fools.
